docs.abstract: The Police Department has agreed to stop using an “alert” noise on the devices after demonstrators and photographers sued, saying it caused migraines and dizziness.
docs.snippet: The Police Department has agreed to stop using an “alert” noise on the devices after demonstrators and photographers sued, saying it caused migraines and dizziness.
docs.lead_paragraph: Police officers first deployed the earsplitting beeps against protesters more than a decade ago in Pittsburgh: Painfully loud noises emitted from a powerful speaker atop a police vehicle, a crowd-control device known informally as a “sound cannon.”

headline.main: N.Y.P.D. to Limit Use of ‘Sound Cannon’ on Crowds After Protesters’ Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: N.Y.P.D. Agrees to Limit  Its Use of ‘Sound Cannon’  As Way to Control Crowds

docs.abstract: Women ran and won in record numbers this year, but the ultimate goal, activists say, is to achieve parity with men in Congress.
docs.snippet: Women ran and won in record numbers this year, but the ultimate goal, activists say, is to achieve parity with men in Congress.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than a month after Election Day, a group of women is still going door to door in and around Atlanta looking for people who do not typically vote. They plan to continue at least until the State Legislature resumes in mid-January, to try to build opposition to restrictive voting laws.

headline.main: Working to Ensure the ‘Year of the Woman’ Is More Than Just One Year
headline.print_headline: Women Return to Hustings, Driven to Build on Midterm Gains

docs.abstract: After a Black executive board member described racism and classism in the leadership ranks of the College Democrats of America, the president of the organization resigned.
docs.snippet: After a Black executive board member described racism and classism in the leadership ranks of the College Democrats of America, the president of the organization resigned.
docs.lead_paragraph: The president of the College Democrats of America resigned on Wednesday, and members of the executive board pledged not to run for re-election, after the board’s only Black member said he had experienced racism and classism from the organization’s leadership.

headline.main: College Democrats, Citing Racism, Force Change in Leadership
headline.print_headline: Claims of Racism Force Leadership Change for College Democrats

docs.abstract: President Emmanuel Macron and others there have been angered by outside criticism.
docs.snippet: President Emmanuel Macron and others there have been angered by outside criticism.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the wake of two horrific incidents of Islamist terrorism in France, President Emmanuel Macron and many of his countrymen have reacted angrily to criticism from abroad suggesting that French policies, and especially the French version of state-enforced secularism, somehow contributed to the lethal radicalization of a sliver of the country’s large Muslim population.

docs.abstract: Broadway.com delayed its “Show of Shows,” set to air Sunday online, in solidarity with those “in the fight for equality and unity” after George Floyd’s death, the site said.
docs.snippet: Broadway.com delayed its “Show of Shows,” set to air Sunday online, in solidarity with those “in the fight for equality and unity” after George Floyd’s death, the site said.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Broadway.com online event that was supposed to help tide theater fans over until the Tony Awards were rescheduled or Broadway productions reopened has been postponed in the wake of ongoing nationwide unrest after the death of George Floyd in police custody on May 25.

headline.main: Tonys Benefit Event Postponed Amid Unrest

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Show of Shows: Broadway.com Salutes the Tonys (Play)

docs.abstract: After 20 years of war, a correspondent looks back.
docs.snippet: After 20 years of war, a correspondent looks back.
docs.lead_paragraph: Shortly after the attacks of Sept. 11, an English teacher in central Washington State assigned her eighth and ninth graders to write poems based on the lead article in The Times. The teacher, Tammy Grubb, said her intention was to give the students a way to process their feelings. The poems were posted in the school hallway and then, since my byline was on the article, Ms. Grubb sent them to me, 77 of them.

headline.main: I Wrote the Lead Times Article on 9/11. Here’s What Still Grips Me.
headline.print_headline: I Wrote the Lead Times Article on 9/11. Here’s What Still Grips Me.

docs.abstract: Elecia R. Dexter is taking over The Democrat-Reporter after her predecessor wrote an editorial calling for the return of the Ku Klux Klan.
docs.snippet: Elecia R. Dexter is taking over The Democrat-Reporter after her predecessor wrote an editorial calling for the return of the Ku Klux Klan.
docs.lead_paragraph: A newspaper in a small city in Alabama that drew condemnation over an editorial calling for the Ku Klux Klan to “ride again” has a new editor and publisher: a 46-year-old black woman.

headline.main: Alabama Newspaper That Called for K.K.K. to ‘Ride Again’ Has a New Editor: A Black Woman

docs.abstract: The shooting of Stephon Clark has reignited the kind of protests against police killings that spread across the United States in recent years.
docs.snippet: The shooting of Stephon Clark has reignited the kind of protests against police killings that spread across the United States in recent years.
docs.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — Two police officers, 10 minutes, 20 bullets. Another young black man dead, this time in his grandmother’s backyard in California’s capital.

headline.main: 20 Shots in Sacramento: Stephon Clark Killing Reignites a Furor
headline.print_headline: Police Kill Another Unarmed Black Man, and Another City Seethes

docs.abstract: The killing of Ms. Everard, 33, has prompted soul-searching over violence against women in Britain. And the breaking up of a banned vigil in her memory has focused criticism on London’s police.
docs.snippet: The killing of Ms. Everard, 33, has prompted soul-searching over violence against women in Britain. And the breaking up of a banned vigil in her memory has focused criticism on London’s police.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The mayor of London and the British cabinet minister responsible for policing called Sunday for an independent inquiry into how the city’s main police force broke up a vigil for Sarah Everard, the 33-year-old marketing executive whose killing has sparked a reckoning over violence against women.

headline.main: Policing at Sarah Everard Vigil in London Faces Official Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: ‘Unacceptable’: Mayor Demands Inquiry Into Police Tactics Used at Slain Executive’s Vigil

docs.abstract: During the pandemic, many people have been unable to make it to the bedside of their dying relatives. I was one of the lucky ones.
docs.snippet: During the pandemic, many people have been unable to make it to the bedside of their dying relatives. I was one of the lucky ones.
docs.lead_paragraph: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

headline.main: Traveling 5,000 Miles to Say Goodbye From Six Feet Away
